qas.question: Where did the American Revolution start?
What did the Declaration Of Independence proclaim?

answers.text: independence from Great Britain and their formation of a cooperative union.

qas.question: What position was Ben Franklin appointed in 1776?

answers.text: member of the Committee of Five that drafted the Declaration of Independence.

qas.question: What was Ben Franklin disabled by?

context: The American Revolution begun with fighting at <a0_0>Lexington and Concord<a0_0/>. On July 4, 1776, they issued the <a1_0>Declaration of Independence<a1_0/>, which proclaimed their <a2_0>independence from Great Britain and their formation of a cooperative union.<a2_0/> In June 1776, Benjamin Franklin was appointed a <a3_0>member of the Committee of Five that drafted the Declaration of Independence.<a3_0/> Although he was temporarily disabled by <a4_0>gout<a4_0/> and unable to attend most meetings of the Committee, Franklin made several small changes to the draft sent to him by Thomas Jefferson.
